item.title: China’s latest military purge is part of a long communist tradition
item.description: Those closest to dictators are simultaneously the most indispensable and the most dangerous.

item.title: The real ‘civilizational erasure’ is happening in America
item.description: Trump’s expansion of state power undermines the West’s core achievement: limits on authority.

item.title: Abigail Spanberger must choose between responsibility or indulgence
item.description: Virginia’s new governor has a choice: follow her mandate or engage in ideological excess.

item.title: ICE tensions are melting from Maine to Minnesota to Capitol Hill
item.description: A deal to avert a shutdown gives the Senate two weeks to negotiate on reasonable Democratic demands.

item.title: Still plunging
item.description: Michael Ramirez cartoon on falling value of the U.S. dollar.

item.title: The technocratic turn that’s giving me hope for Gaza
item.description: Reconstruction efforts in the battered enclave are better planned and organized than many realize.

item.title: Texas freezes out good doctors
item.description: Pausing H-1B visa hiring for public universities hurts U.S. patients.

item.title: How to stay physically active in frigid weather
item.description: Even in extreme cold spell, everyone — including kids — should find ways to exercise.

item.title: Jack Smith and the real threat to constitutional order
item.description: Jack Smith, Virginia Military Institute and surviving the snow, in readers’ eyes.

item.title: I’ve reported on UFO sightings for decades — and come to this conclusion
item.description: We call them UAPs now, but they’re the same thing. Why do so many people believe in them?

item.title: The real problem with the climate movement? Demand.
item.description: Curbing emissions can’t be about stopping the development of energy infrastructure.

item.title: Forget TACO. It’s GUAC that matters with Trump’s tariffs.
item.description: Those who mock Trump’s tariff tactics are missing the secret sauce.

item.title: The left is badly misreading the politics of illegal immigration
item.description: There’s a reason sanctuary cities are the epicenter of clashes. It’s not the one Democrats think.

item.title: The unsettling truth revealed by the attempted attack on Ilhan Omar
item.description: Ilhan Omar should not have to fear for her safety to espouse her views, even if they are extreme.

item.title: A bipolar economy is hard to sell
item.description: The president keeps getting distracted by foreign policy as voters worry about their cost of living.

item.title: I was a Marine in Afghanistan. ICE’s tactics are strategically incoherent.
item.description: Minnesota unrest, photo credibility and the Philadelphia slavery panel removal, in readers eyes.

item.title: A year after DCA crash, an easy fix to prevent more midair collisions
item.description: The NTSB has recommended the adoption of a detection technology 17 times since 2006.

item.title: I photographed the Iranian Revolution. This brutality goes further.
item.description: In 1979, I photographed a revolution that seemed unstoppable. But time has turned the tables.

item.title: They don’t give an inch. Even when an American is killed.
item.description: For Trump officials, fighting the administration’s enemies is more important than being decent.

item.title: Greenland isn’t the answer to U.S. Arctic security. This place is.
item.description: The U.S. could start building a true Arctic fortress in Alaska tomorrow.
